text.#text:
The
			 term

header.#text:
Use of certain
			 Offshore oil and gas platforms for artificial reefs

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall conduct an assessment of each of the platforms—

text.#text:
As
			 soon as practicable after the date of enactment of this Act, the

to determine
			 whether there are coral populations or other protected species in the vicinity
			 of the platform; and

to identify any
			 species in the vicinity of the platform that have recreational or commercial
			 value.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
has
			 completed assessments of each of the platforms under

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Rigs to Reefs Habitat Protection Act/s:3/ss:a

text.#text:
Notwithstanding the Notice, no platforms shall be removed
			 in accordance with the Notice until the date on which the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Rigs to Reefs Habitat Protection Act/s:3/ss:a

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
determines that there is a substantial reef
			 ecosystem in the vicinity of the platform, the decommissioning of the platform
			 under the Notice shall be placed on hold until such time as the

determines that decommissioning the platform would not harm the reef
			 ecosystem.

text.#text: If, during an assessment conducted under

The requirement in the Notice that a lessee
			 remove a platform as soon as possible, but not later than 5 years after the
			 effective date of the Notice or within 5 years of the platform, meeting the
			 definition of no longer useful for operations, whichever is later, shall not
			 apply to a lessee that—

commits to
			 entering the platform in the Program; and

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
by initiating discussions with applicable
			 States regarding potential sites for the artificial reef.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Rigs to Reefs Habitat Protection Act/s:3/ss:c/p:1

text.#text:
demonstrates the
			 commitment described in

A lessee may, as appropriate, provide for
			 reefing in place under the Program.

A State that has a State rig-to-reef program may enter
			 into an agreement with any appropriate entities to assume liability in Federal
			 water for a structure covered by the State program.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, the operator of the covered
			 structure shall remain responsible for maintaining the covered
			 structure.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Rigs to Reefs Habitat Protection Act/s:3/ss:c/p:1

text.#text:
Notwithstanding
			 an agreement entered into under

Under the Program, top decks of a rig may be removed, down
			 to water surface level, if appropriate identifying markers are used to protect
			 navigation.

As a condition of inclusion in the
			 Program, the owner of a rig enrolled in the Program shall be required
			 to—

maintain an anode
			 system for the rig; and

pay into the Fund
			 an amount equal to 50 percent of the estimated costs associated with the
			 removal of the platform that the owner would have been responsible for if the
			 owner had not participated in the Program, as determined by the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, to be
			 available without fiscal year limitation and not subject to appropriation, for
			 the maintenance of artificial reefs established under the Program.

text.#text:
There
			 is established in the Treasury of the United States a fund to be known as the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Rigs to Reefs Habitat Protection Act/s:3/ss:g/p:2

text.#text:
The Fund shall consist of such amounts deposited in the Fund
			 under

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Rigs to Reefs Habitat Protection Act/s:3/ss:h/p:1

text.#text:
Amounts
			 in the Fund may not be made available for any purpose other than a purpose
			 described in

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Committee on
			 Appropriations of the House of Representatives

Committee on Appropriations
			 of the Senate
Committee on Energy and Natural Resources of the Senate

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
a report on
			 the operation of the Fund during the fiscal year.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Committee on Natural Resources of the House of Representatives

text.#text:
Not later than 60 days after the end of each fiscal year
			 beginning with fiscal year 2013, the

A
			 statement of the amounts deposited into the Fund.

A
			 description of the expenditures made from the Fund for the fiscal year,
			 including the purpose of the expenditures.

Recommendations
			 for additional authorities to fulfill the purpose of the Fund.

A
			 statement of the balance remaining in the Fund at the end of the fiscal
			 year.

Each
			 report shall include, for the fiscal year covered by the report, the
			 following:

current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

To authorize the use of certain offshore oil and gas
		  platforms in the Gulf of Mexico for artificial reefs, and for other
		  purposes.
